column2: unde vèniet aŭxìlium mìhi. ^ I have lifted up my eyes to the mountains
column3: from whence help shall come to me.

column2: qŭi fecit caĕlum et terram. ^ My help is from the Lord

column1: 3 ^ Non det in commotiónem pèdem tuum
column2: nèqŭe dormítet qŭi custódit te. ^ May he not suffer thy foot to be moved
column3: neither let him slumber that keepeth thee.

column1: 4 ^ Ecce non dormitábit nèqŭe dórmiet qŭi custódit Israhélem. ^ Behold he shall neither slumber nor sleep that keepeth Israel.

column2: Dòminus protèctio tua super manum dèxteram tuam. ^ The Lord is thy keeper
column3: the Lord is thy protection upon thy right hand.

column1: 6 ^ Per diem sol non uret te
column2: nèqŭe luna per noctem. ^ The sun shall not burn thee by day

column1: 7 ^ Dòminus custódit te ab omni malo~; custódiat ánimam tuam Dòminus. ^ The Lord keepeth thee from all evil~; may the Lord keep thy soul.

column4: et usqŭe in sáĕculum. ^ May the Lord keep thy coming in and thy going out
column5: from henceforth now and for ever.
